overview:
Timothy Williams is Founder and CEO of DIME Public Relations (www.DIMEpr.com), an international public relations agency.

DIME Public Relations was founded in May 2008 by Williams, a former senior-level marketing communications executive in the online gambling industry, a career which landed him in the Central American paradise of Costa Rica in 2003 where he continues to reside today.

Williams left the online gambling industry in 2006 after the passage of federal legislation aimed at curtailing the growth of online gambling in the United States. Williams was hired as a Managing Director for Pop Culture PR, an award-winning consumer and lifestyle PR agency located in Los Angeles two months later. Williams would serve full-time in his capacity as Managing Director at Pop Culture PR from his home office in Costa Rica until launching DIME PR in May of 2008.

In addition to running the day-to-day operations of DIME PR, Williams continues to serve in an advisory role at Pop Culture PR.

DIME PR is a small, aggressive boutique PR agency which maintains a strong emphasis on its technology practice area and specializes in working with startups and early-stage companies who can’t afford to waste capital on overpriced agencies.

DIME PR puts its clients in front of the tech world’s largest audiences and influencers. Our clients are routinely featured in outlets such as: TechCrunch, Lifehacker, GigaOM, PC Magazine, PC World, NetworkWorld, CNET, and many, many more.

DIME PR believes in a full-contact approach to PR - traditional media, new media, and social media combined in one driving force to create awareness, preference, and demand.
